title: xrobot example
body: Examples in xrobot/python_examples directory needs extra files whose paths are hard coded. Are there any examples which I can run directly?

title: offset between collision object and visual mesh (xworld3d/models_3d/goal/*)
body:
Hi, 

I am using ```XWorld/games/xworld3d/models_3d``` assets on my simulator. 

As I load URDF of the 3d models, there're offset between collision mesh and visual mesh. 

My simulator uses a coordinate system which of y-axis points upward. Any idea why is it the case?

![ViewerScreenshot_0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3031724/56687289-39c8b480-66d6-11e9-94d8-5a672e24715a.png)

![ViewerScreenshot_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3031724/56687296-3b927800-66d6-11e9-83e3-3b9bd810854f.png)

title: How to solve the OpenGL problem??
body:
OK when I run ./test_xworld3d.sh 
I got:
ERROR::SHADER::COMPILATION_FAILED: simple_texturing.vert.glsl

ERROR::SHADER::PROGRAM::LINKING_FAILED
ERROR::SHADER::PROGRAM::LINKING_FAILED

I find it seems like to be a .glsl file loading error,but How Can I Fix It????

Thanks
